hymn.title: Dead in sin and void of purpose

layout.singingstanza: Dead in sin and void of pur -- pose, In pur -- suit of van -- i -- ty; Oc -- cu -- pied with life's vain -- glo -- ry, Groped I for my life's true mean -- ing In the world and with -- out Thee, In the world and with -- out Thee.

lyrics.stanza: Dead in sin and void of purpose, In pursuit of vanity; Occupied with life's vainglory, Groped I for my life's true meaning In the world and without Thee, In the world and without Thee.
Then one day I heard the gospel, I believed and called on Thee; Thou as life came in to fill me, Making life so full of meaning As the Son revealed in me, As the Son revealed in me.
All-inclusive was the transfer, Baptized—four-fold—into Thee, Into Thy death, Body, and Person, Thus to live and walk in newness; One in life and living with Thee, One in life and living with Thee.
Using all things, persons, and matters Thou art disciplining me Till by outer man consuming, And my inner-man renewing; 'Tis no longer I but Thee 'Tis no longer I but Thee.
Not alone but with Thy members Thou art sweetly placing me; Fitting me into Thy building, Blending out all self distinctions, That Thy church would builded be, That Thy church would builded be.
